message: A good index! Especially by ingredient, like bean, zucchini, tofu, etc.
Pictures.  Low fat (no oil etc).  Whole food plant based recipes.  Simple/few ingredients.
I have to agree, a good index by ingredient is a BIG plus.  Pictures in a cookbook always make me buy it.   And substitutions for ingredients that you might not have on hand that day is a huge help!
@StephORama It took me a long time but i did it by ingredient--except for things like spices.
@jrhicks both this book and my last one are full of pictures, no oil, everyday ingredients and whole foods!

Pictures of each recipe would be ideal. Even if some are smaller than the ones in your current book, just so that you have a general idea of what you're cooking and how it would look. I've only cooked the recipes that have pics so far! :D

Pictures are awesome! It's great to get an idea of where I'm heading while I'm cooking. Also, I value the cookbooks I own that have recipes I can't find somewhere else or aren't something I could have figured out how to make myself or have new ways of cooking things I haven't seen before. Nothing will get a cookbook off my shelf and off to Goodwill faster than calling for weird, expensive ingredients or is simply a rehash of recipes that I currently have in another book.
